STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
January 10, 2023
Karen Lee Southgate
TUSCOLA COUNTY DHHS
1365 CLEAVER RD,
CARO, MI, 48723-9135
RE: License#: CP790201478
TUSCOLA COUNTY DHHS
1365 CLEAVER RD,
CARO, MI, 48723-9135
Dear Karen Southgate:
Your license is renewed. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable.
If you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
You will be receiving the license in the mail. Please review it for accuracy.
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
01/04/2023. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and MISEP requirements. It should be noted
that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract.
As indicated above substantial compliance has been established therefore, your license
is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (734) 395-0920.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
No violations

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
No violations
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
No violations
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
None
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
CAP was submitted for noncompliance identified in interim evaluation 1/7/2022.
Identified noncompliance with 510(1)(a) and ISEP 6.49. CAP was approved
2/1/2022. There are no identified repeat noncompliance.
The Chief Administrator’s Assessment included a review of the agency’s progress in
completing the approved corrective action plan. Action steps were identified as well
as a review of the agency’s status with key performance indicators. There was no
repeat noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The comments made by foster parents and relative caregivers to the analyst at the
time of her visits were generally positive in nature and indicated being supported by
the agency. There was one safety alert involving a pool at a relative home. The alert
was resolved with the installation of door alarms and the acquisition of a safety
flotation device. Picture documentation was received to confirm resolution.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
01/06/2023
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
01/09/2022
Kari Muntean Date
Area Manager
